data: SUS Injectable Opioid Agonist Treatment (iOAT) with HYDROmorphone for Opioid Use Disorder
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
None

If patient on methadone prior to admission, any prescriber can order the same methadone dose as prior to admission. Consider consult with site specific addiction service or provincial addiction Rapid Access to Consultative Expertise (RACE) line
None
Only providers who have satisfied their provincial college requirements can prescribe injectable opioid agonist treatment for opioid use disorder
None
Patient Care
None
Insert Peripheral IV Catheter
T;N
Medications
None
Please assess the possible need for dose adjustment if patient has been off injectable opioid agonist treatment for greater than 24 hours
None
Alert patients' community pharmacy of hospitalization and consider discontinuation of community injectable opioid agonist treatment prescription if ordering in hospital
None
Discontinue all previous hospital HYDROmorphone orders prior to initiating injectable opioid agonist treatment
None
